Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nJgVJYozjpXvqDkCbuRs5Q.text: Full disclosure: this review was written last fall and somehow never posted.   I wish I could do separate reviews for different meals. I have been here four times since they opened, twice for dinner, once for breakfast, and once for lunch. On the whole, the food is good to great. Breakfast and lunch are definitely their strengths, and their pizza and sandwiches are spectacular.   Dinner is solid, but nothing I'd write home about. The bolognese is the way to go for pasta. I didn't enjoy the greens and beans; they were a little strange and didn't resemble anything I'm accustomed to, but perhaps this is a preference thing. The tiramisu struck me as a little soggy, but my boyfriend enjoyed it. We both agreed that the bread and oil was the best part of the meal.   I would really like to give this place more stars, but what knocked it down for me was the service. Both times I have been here for dinner the staff was less than satisfactory. On my first visit during restaurant week, service was terribly slow for the number of customers present, and the request to split the check was met with extreme annoyance. (Full disclosure: I recognize this can be inconvenient for servers, but it was a table full of ladies. They split out one friend's check as she has a nut allergy and they brought the check with candied almonds. While this was very considerate, I'm not sure why the server wouldn't have asked if they are able to separate our checks as well.)   On my second visit, a double date before a concert, the service was again slow. Our waitress was much better, but the manager/bartender (?not sure what her official title is) was very condescending. We ordered after dinner drinks and my friend's contained a fraction of everyone else's (we ordered the same thing) and didn't look anything like the others. When she asked if the drink could be remade, the bar manager returned with the same drink to explain that this drink was made as it was supposed to be and was what my friend had ordered. My friend has extensive bartending experience (and not just at 'a beer and a shot' kind of places, but legitimate cocktail bars), so she knew this was incorrect, but by that point we were in a rush to get to the show (again, slow service) and didn't have time to argue further. Highly recommend the breakfast and brunch scene here, but I'd scope out other options for dinner if you're craving Italian.

QdFuWKkggF2iCGVDaxB8dw.text: One of the worst dinners we've experienced in Pittsburgh. Just another faux gourmet eatery with tacky trendy decor and AWFUL food. The atmosphere was very unenjoyable and our server barely spoke English. He treated us like we were idiots that have never dined out before.   My main course was the Rye Rigotti--looked as disgusting as it tasted. It appeared to be a bowl of slop that tasted like dirty dishwater.   Truly a horrible experience.   I definitely do not recommend. Nothing like the photos or reputation. We won't be back.

jn-E9F6u1GMbWhv8hfLQcw.text: Oh my gosh if you want A fish between delicious pizza, sauce and delicate gnocchi - order this gnocchi bread bowl. Gnocchi has to made just right and they do it right here.  And their cheesy sauce is amazing with the perfect kinds of cheeses blended together.  Really an amazing delicious meal!  I high recommend it!

IYEmutNtUmm2lPFbSC-TYQ.text: This is a nice but family friendly Italian restaurant.  The staff is helpful and courteous.  I would highly recommend the gnocchi in the bread bowl , it's a meal for 2 and you won't regret it! Good portions and high quality food.  Make sure to make a reservation.

5vD60mOeBzVPdorX4ya1uw.text: This is now my absolutely favorite Pittsburgh restaurant. First off, the service was great! Our waiter really cared and took his time with us to help us choose the best possible meal. The pasta was fresh, made in house. It was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of bite. The portions are larger than many fine dining establishments. The pricing is very reasonable. You pay for a nice portion of good quality food. When I go out I like to choose items that I won't make at home... they have plenty of creative dishes to choose from. Also, they made delightful mock tails for us. The flourless chocolate cake had a little hint of almond that was just right. We will be back!!!

43OK9nrkj9tnXKmIBqbl0A.text: 4.5 stars for Excellent pizza, fresh ingredients and food cooked fresh and hot.  5 stars for the awesome atmosphere, casual and trendy. Friendly service.  5stars for the dessert--snickerdoodle Nutella sandwich, Italian doughnuts (fried to order), and Calabrian Chile mocha.   5 stars overall

PlA1fMqnelva02LWBZs5ww.text: DiAnoia's was really good! My husband and I were not a huge fan of their red sauce, but he is also from Italy - so can be rather picky with his marinara's. I had the mushroom dish and it was top-notch. Their fresh bread with oil was also to die for. My friend got the gnocchi and my goddness was it delish. The gnocchis were huge and fluffy.   The acoustics in DiAnoia's need some help, though. It was so stinkin' loud in there, I could not hear my husband or my two friends who were sitting right next to me!

oGdIAFjek0KBPA0yM16Ehg.text: Gotta update (is it still an update if it's still 5 stars?) my brunch review after visiting DiAnoia's for dinner last night and having another phenomenal meal and experience... and I am really not ever one to choose to eat at Italian restaurants/rarely ever eat pasta.  After grabbing a drink at the bar, our reservation was ready and we were seated. We were lucky enough to have JP as our server again and he, to no surprise, took great care of us.  You can really tell the staff here enjoys the atmosphere and is proud of their level of service and quality of food and drinks they serve. JP, again, provided great recommendations and engaged with us in a fun, but not overbearing way.  We placed an order for the house salad and the escarole, beans and sausage to start and it was brought out with yummy bread. I would definitely recommend the beans and greens again, but would maybe try a different vegetable dish in place of the house salad - though it was fresh with olives, tomatoes, house Italian dressing and chick peas.  For my meal, I ordered the gnocchi with meatballs and he had the taglitelle agnello (pasta in a lamb bolognese sauce).  Our dishes came out piping hot and were literally mouth-watering good.  The pasta was fresh, cooked to perfection, not heavy at all and the gnocchi was so light and airy and delicious.  The flavor was absolutely perfect and I am so happy we both had leftovers to take home and enjoy again!!  We had another round of drinks while we ate and I ordered the martini perfecto and my date had a Peroni.  My martini was good, but not what I had expected.  I was looking for something along the lines of a more traditional dirty martini.  I am glad to have tried another cocktail off of the menu, but I probably would not order it again (just not my style).  Because we were there for a celebration dinner, and even after we declined, JP was nice enough to bring out what he told us was his favorite dessert - a cream-filled pastry sprinkled with powdered sugar.  I highly suggest, regardless of how full you are, ordering this and devouring it there or taking it to go because it was the perfect end to a wonderful meal.  Truly one of the better places to eat in Pittsburgh and one of my new go-to recommendations to people that ask.  Thanks DiAnoias!

URcRgJyXu7loljzINTzKxA.text: Most all of the people that have given less than 5 star reviews for DiAnoia's are being far too particular.  The server my wife and I had was incredibly patient with all our questions and was very attentive.  But seriously, if someone is bringing you food like this they can snarl and call you Shirley and it shouldn't matter.  If you haven't been here yet, make it a night you'll never forget.  Buy yourself a bottle of wine, order the greens and beans, a side of fresh bread, and the gnocchi and meatballs. You won't find a better meal on this side of the Atlantic.  Thank me later.

LbGGSCUYYnKAp0T-QbxhfQ.text: The food here was delicious and the staff were friendly. Parking was sparse because it is in the strip district, with lots of other restaurants and places. We came here for brunch, and we had a large party of 10 and they were very accommodating. The restaurant is well-lit with lots of window space. I got hot sausage, egg, and cheese on a bagel with potatoes and some zeppoles. Everything was delicious and everyone else thoroughly enjoyed their meals as well!

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot sausage, egg, and cheese on a bagel with potatoes and some zeppoles

d_Z_qrcwKsn5fh7bCKDOBA.text: This is one of my favorite Italian places in the city. It can sometimes be hard to get a table here so I would recommend a reservation. If not, definitely expect a bit of a wait. My friend and I came here for dinner and they practically had to roll us out of the place. We started out with the meat and cheese board, which was yummy. We also had the bread with ricotta cheese. I am a carb lover so I couldn't get enough of this. I had the Gnocchi bowl and if you've seen a picture of it, it absolutely tastes as good as it looks!  My friend has the Orrecchiette pasta and said that it was delicious. The only thing that I dislike about this place is how close the tables are. It kind of ruins the vibe in my opinion. It's something you can ignore though based off of how good the food is!

trU2Gv1VnlMPZUIWABki5A.text: Outstanding! From the moment we stepped into the establishment on 5/11. They hosted a birthday party and it was excellent. The food, the service, the deserts, etc. They made the guest of honor feel special on her birthday... absolutely 5 star and will return again. Highly recommend.

ADSnvhHvtXhCxEa1cjonhQ.text: Brunch here was spectacular. I wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was. There were lots of tasty options, both savory and sweet. Definitely try the Italian donuts...they were warm and delicious! If you want something sweet, try the lemon ricotta pancakes and if you want something savory, try the eggs in purgatory. Top it all off with a fancy cocktail and you're looking at one of the best brunches in Pittsburgh.

PElTm3uT5W9o7SA9dPpMSA.text: Been eyeing the gnocchi bowl video from Thrillist for a few months now and had to try... We went for dinner and ordered the Arancini to start, and the Gnocchi, Sorrentina style, as well as the Asparagi Taglialoni. The Arancini were delicious, much creamier interior than expecting. The Gnocchi bowl was certainly worth the hype...we enjoyed it so much that we did not even touch the Taglialoni at the restaurant (although, when eaten leftover, was incredibly creamy and delish)! The gnocchi were little pillows of delight, and we enjoyed dipping pieces of the breadbowl in the creamy sauce mixed with the pecorino. Well done, DiAnoia's...we will certainly be back for more!

OfMBD23b-hX0uOexGtAUNg.text: Been meaning to try this place for so long so glad we finally got to come ! Everything from the host to sitting down was great ! Super nice service amazing food ! I got the gnocchi and my bf got the cacio e Pepe ! I can't even explain the taste lol I can't wait to eat the leftovers tomorrow !

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FhZxyh-PChOBfvfYCfWT0A.text: Just ok... Brussel sprouts were too salty. Eggplant fritters were frozen inside and had to send back. And gnocchi was extremely overrated. On the positive, the pasta was yummy and the escarole, sausage and beans was delish! Overall, not sure what the fuss is all about. I doubt we'll return:-(

D1cYzOwfGs9awFgrX-DU5g.text: Feasted on DiAnoia's for a week, post company party catering. Cheesy cauliflower goodness with pesto was insane. Perfect combo of garlic, spice, and cheese. Paired with the chicken parm to send you into cheesy Italian food coma.   Aside from the carbs, an arugula, apples, pecan, and goat cheese salad was present. Lemon vinaigrette dressing rained down from the food heavens to seal the deal.   Highly recommended.

xNuzvYgp9nBAHKheDwMRdQ.text: DiAnoia's Eatery is an amazing addition to the Pittsburgh restaurant scene!! I had heard great things about it and was so excited to come here for the first time in April for my birthday.  The dinner started out poorly for personal reasons - I lost my wallet at the Carnegie Museum beforehand! - so I knew this restaurant was amazing when it turned my frown upside down. We started with the fresh bread with oil and parmigiano reggiano, which was absolutely delectable. The bread tastes like amazing pizza crust made from the freshest ingredients in a little cafe in Italy. We quickly gobbled up every last morsel. For my entree, I ordered the potato gnocchi which was covered in meatballs and a classic red sauce. The gnocchi was perfectly fluffy, and the sauce was light and flavorful, the perfect complement to the hearty meatballs. For dessert, I selected the tiramisu. It was a classic, alcohol-soaked treat. I'm sad to say that I like less alcoholic, Americanized tiramisu a little bit better, but this dessert pays homage to the Italian original. In addition to the amazing food, the service was excellent. Our waiter was very polite and efficient, and our food was prompt.  During our meal in April, I suggested that we bring our guests visiting in June to the restaurant! I am so happy to say that we did. This time, we tried DiAnoia's for Sunday brunch and were not disappointed. Sometimes, a restaurant serves either delicious brunch or dinner, but this restaurant shines for both. We started with trying the stuffed cornetti, Nutella panzerotti, and zeppole. I would have never tried the stuffed cornetti, but my brother-in-law (who's of Italian descent and has family from Pennsylvania) couldn't stop raving about how much he loved Lebanon bologna. All three of the starters were amazing, but I have to say that the zeppole was my favorite of the incredible options. These little Italian doughnuts were perfectly doughy and lemony. For my main dish, I tried the Lemon & Ricotta pancakes and had a few bites of my husband's Steak Florentine meal. For me, the Steak Florentine was a bit too savory and rich and needed a bit of sweetness, but it was the perfect accompaniment to my light and fluffy Lemon & Ricotta pancakes. In addition to the food, I tried the Chocolate Chai. Even though it was 90 degrees outside, the beverage hit the spot.  In summary: DiAnoia's = Amazing DiAnoia's is an incredible Italian restaurant that feels straight out of Italy. DiAnoia's offers both flavorful brunch and dinner and many must-try dishes.  I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sunday Brunch! --- Branca Menta Mocha, Stuffed Cornetti, and Zeppole

xbz6bbu19tA0sPVBcS4c3Q.text: If there is one thing I love its Brunch. This place might be the best kept secret in Pittsburgh when it comes to impressive food and customer service. Every time I come here, I am even more amazed at the quality of the food - wether its a date or a business meeting this place ALWAYS delivers a quality experience.

47oRbL_GeSdRf259vHMfvQ.text: Absolutely delicious. Went with a group of friends for dinner and we shared the bread and Whipped Ricotta, I got the meatballs and sauce with agnello sugo which was amazing. Dessert was Zeppole that had a citrusy taste but delicious. Like others have said, the noodles are very fresh, delicious and homemade. The waiter gave an amazing recommendation for wine and IPA for my friends. Highly recommend for authentic Italian but make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meatballs with agnello sugo

BtCUfenmraVS_wquRaHQ4w.text: I love the decor I feel like I'm in Italy but I'm actually in the strip district. The menu had a lot of great Italian dishes but sad to say I was hungry for spaghetti which tasted like my grandmother made it. Just enough meat sauce and the noodles were done perfect not soggy. The waitress was super nice no complaints the spaghetti was $14 but your also paying for the  atmosphere.

i2xZWnFR98ZKhVpc8Z8Gvg.text: This is more of a 4.5 star review, but that isn't an option! The only thing that knocked the score down was how heavy on alcohol the tiramisu was. It was still tasty, but I'm pregnant and the strong alcohol taste made me uncomfortable, so I split it with my husband.  But on to everything else, my husband brought me here for my 30th birthday dinner. We had reservations and were seated right away. It was pretty empty when we got there at 6 p.m. but it was full when we left. We really loved the minimalist style of the restaurant as it reminded us of the restaurants we ate at on the Amalfi coast. It looks like it could have been plucked right out of Italy. Our waitress was extremely attentive and when I asked if they could make me a mocktail at the bar, she knew the right questions to ask and got me something I really enjoyed. It was a mix of lemon and vanilla and I'll definitely be requesting it in the future.  We ordered the bread and olive oil as an appetizer and I got a salad with oregano dressing to eat before dinner as well. The bread was simple but amazing. They clearly know what they are doing. It had fresh parmesan sprinkled on top and my mouth is watering just thinking about it. The salad was also delicious. Fresh, and the dressing was unique and tangy.   For our meals, my husband ordered the gnocchi and meatballs and I got the impossible lasagna. We were both extremely pleased. The lasagna had both red sauce and pesto, which I have never thought to put together, and it was incredibly tasty. When I make lasagna, I include a ton of cheese. This was much lighter on cheese than what I normally prefer, but I didn't even care.   As mentioned above, we had the tiramisu for dessert. Again, it was good, just a little bit too boozy.   We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A custom mocktail.
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad with oregano dressing.

W8LwYLLS0wSX9-NQO-YWOg.text: This is for sure one of the best Italian restaurants in Pittsburgh. The service was kind of slow but the food made up for it! The atmosphere is fun as well. The decor will remind you of a traditional Italian home and the food as well!

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meat and cheese board
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Italian margarita and spritz

sCpe5l3jcz4zFVltr8sxQw.text: There are a lot, I mean a real lot, of pizza places in and around Pittsburgh and few if any do it like DiAnoia's does! This is a True Pittsburgh staple and a must stop for everyone to enjoy! They have such a creative menu like no place else and everything is freshly prepared and tastes like grandmas best recipe! If pizza isn't your thing I'd recommend the wedding soup! Again, it tastes like grandmas fresh batch with all the best ingredients! Definitely worth spending some time here again and again!

zDo6CREbCPkBzmtde-8R1g.text: I finally came here after being recommended to try it for a third time by friends and co-workers and am so glad I did!  It's definitely a good idea to make a reservation first on opentable because the restaurant can be packed at certain times.  The service was great, our waitress had really good recommendations, was very knowledgeable, and came back multiple times to check up on how we were doing.  Apparently their menu changes every couple of weeks so there's always new variety to their dishes also a few popular ones never change. We had gotten the polpo fritta (fried octopus) as an appetizer which was a bit too salty but still very delicious. For entrees I got the cacio e Pepe and added blue crab to it. The portion was pretty big and I think it was a good idea to add protein to it. My wife had gotten the cappelletti primavera and I thought it was even better than mine. You cannot go wrong with the gnocchi either, which had very tender potato dumplings and flavorful meatballs.  The only negative factor was the noise level. It sounded almost like a high school cafeteria inside but I'm not sure there's much that can be done about that. (Maybe decrease the volume on the background jazz music so that guests aren't yelling to hear each other) Otherwise all in all I really enjoyed my experience here and will definitely be coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Polpo Frita
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cappelletti primavera with shrimp
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Branzino

mN8Eyevb-WryZKcR6SFnhg.text: Just okay.  The coffee was meh, and the sandwiches are overpriced and hit or miss.  Pastries aren't bad though, and the service is pretty good.

1-3zTzGhEuII42obDhQL9g.text: Ahhhh mazing! My "supper club" came here last night for our monthly dinner. I made reservations a week ago, they could only fit us in at 9:30p. We were a little hesitant because it was so late, but we all agreed it was well worth the wait!   Tips: Make sure you get the bread with the ricotta.  The bread is thin with bubbles, some parts are nice and crisp. They have just the right about of oil and sprinkled cheese on it, and dipped in the whipped ricotta it's amazing.   We loved the meatballs - I'm picky too (I have 2 100% Italian Grandma's so I know my meatballs). Make sure you try some with the bread too..   Beans and greens were also a hit. They came out kind of soupy so I was hesitant, but the flavoring was perfect. The sausage def made it.   I had the pasta in lemon cream sauce shrimp and scallops.....mouth water. Portion sizes are huge, you'll definitely take the rest home for another meal or 2. Also got to taste my friends gnocchi in the bread bowl which was also sooo good.  We tried some of the cookies from their little bakery. Fav was the snickerdoodle between some Nutella.   We all agreed that we love this place and can't wait to come back. I heard their brunch and lunch are good too.   Only thing we didn't like is that it gets so noisy! It was hard to hear each other. The place was packed. This got better as people were leaving because we were there so late.

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Home made cookies from the bakery!
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The bread and ricotta dip
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lemon pasta with shrimp and scallops

8Ki7LwLv21UiP44fhtlrxQ.text: Wonderfully authentic Italian food, prompt service and a lively decor.  We loved the bread, the olives, all the appetizers were outstanding. The bread is hard to describe, other than it's a large puffball.   My ravioli was definitely house-made and delicious. The gnocchi was fluffy and tasty.   Our server helped us navigate the menu and gave many helpful vegetarian suggestions.   While so many places are too dark to even read a menu, DiAnoia's is bright, clean and cheerful.   There's a deli on one side, and a caffe counter.   The wine list could include some more reasonably priced bottles, they appear to be marking up their wine 100%.   I'm not sure why they don't buy a $14 bottle of Chianti and offer it for $22. For example, their Rosato Librandi, Calabria 2016 sells for $12.99 in the State Store, but they mark it up to $45.

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. AVOCADO CROSTINI Honey + Ricotta, Avocado, Toasted House Bread
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GplVloeeNalvGlz3KIC0RQ.text: Gnocchi in a bread bowl people. I repeat gnocchi in a bread bowl. I'm half Italian and miss my Nana so much and her homemade gnocchi. No one ever gets it right. I've been to so many places that claim frozen ones were homemade or if they were homemade they were of low quality. That is NOT the case here. Absolutely freaking fantastically delicious. When we leave here it's like carb overload and I have to unbutton my pants and can barely walk out the door to go home. It's so good that I can't control myself and keep eating until I put myself in a food coma.

35_n02oK4uboN1zp61lesQ.text: DELICIOUS! This place served up the best gnocchi I have ever had. We started with bread which was covered in cheese and oil (in a good way). It was basically a pizza without sauce. We also ordered cocktails which were pretty strong and definitely worth the price. The entrees definitely were the stars of the show: Gnocchi with Meatballs, Red Sauce, and Pecorino Romano and Branzinio All'Amatriciana (Rigatoni). DiAnoia's makes all of their pasta fresh, so I would highly recommend choosing one of those dishes. Only (minor) complaint is that we sat on the bar side and it was extremely hot that evening. Overall, awesome Italian!

YMSDG7tUEJBaASYfic-TtA.text: Went for lunch on my niece's recommendation and I was not disappointed!   I reviewed all of the menus because they have one for lunch,  brunch, and dinner.   And being a vegetarian I would have to say I would have a very difficult time for dinner but the lunch was excellent and the brunch menu looks wonderful  too.   My friend and I split the caprese Panini and the eggplant Panini and the roasted cauliflower everything was excellent including the very special drinks that the bartender mixed for us!

VaZtQeQVfzPa-WjUrN2yvg.text: I have been here at least 5 times now and have never been disappointed by anything. I've brought my dad here who is a big steak house guy and he was awed by the steak Florentine which is always on menu. The I've had the gnocchi both sorrentina style and normal with the meatballs and it's honestly the best gnocchi I've ever had. The menu changes a lot but everything I've had has been great. Most recently I had a crab pasta with ramps and peas that was heavenly. The fresh bread with olive oil is a must as are the meatballs and even my picky vegetarian sister has raved about the pesto cauliflower! Give this place a try you won't regret it!

Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggplant fritters
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh bread

kP9HpeWFpiZtkSJGWdvhkA.text: Good food but always way too busy for my liking. I prefer the dinner menu over brunch but both are good! Drinks are also super good!

AwPcjq6-Z0JlIIJjP65d1A.text: FOOD: AMAZING sandwiches. Went there and couldn't decide on the prosciutto sandwich or the Italiano so I ended up getting both and I don't regret it at all. I'm not even much of a sandwich person but everything tasted so fresh and delicious i loved it.   DRINK: The bloody Mary was clearly made from a homemade mix as you could taste the tomatoe puree, so gains automatic points with me. It was as legitimate as you could get.  AMBIANCE: Went during lunch and I guess they don't provide service at that time? So we ordered from the counter, and when it's ready they bring the food out and call your name and deliver it to your table. Cute bar area and expensive artwork decorating the inside. Nice but not fancy. All around awesome.

ne0sva6wODpjW-E6Z3ReEA.text: Great experience. This place is so cute! It was packed in the middle of the week and the service was still fast. Everyone was so friendly.   We ordered the bread because apparently it's the best thing on the menu. It was so delicious and definitely something everyone needs to pick at before the main course.   The food was great as was the vibe. I'll definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

o1V5i35oqmcpXLhGnyDu0w.text: Came for a weekend brunch. Group of four, no reservation, right at 11am, so we figured we'd have some waiting ahead of us. They were super accommodating and sat us at two open seats at the bar next to two diners who were wrapping up. Once those two seats opened up, we were able to sit and order! All told, we only waited about 15 minutes.   For food, one friend ordered the veal Parmesan, I got the European breakfast, and the last two (one vegetarian and one who doesn't eat pork) went for the egg sandwich. Their brunch menu that day appeared to have limited meatless options other than the egg sandwich and a french toast, and the meat options were mainly pork based, unless one wanted to opt for the veal or a fancy steak. Two of us ordered drinks: a Calabrian mocha (mocha w/ chilis) and an espresso.  The drinks came out first: the mocha was very good! Sweet & a bit spiced, but with a rich chocolate flavor. The espresso unfortunately was very sour and difficult to drink.  The food then came out without much wait. The European breakfast was a lovely platter of cheese, meats, fruit, and a small cornetti. There was a bleu cheese, provolone, and a third cheese that resembled Swiss, although I never confirmed. It was all very tasty! My friend enjoyed his veal parmesean as well, however the two who'd gotten the egg sandwich remarked that it seemed to be mostly bread (although the bread itself was very good).   Our brunch was overall good but definitely had some hiccups. Based on other reviews, it seems we'd have to come back for dinner sometime to get a complete DiAnoia's experience!

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. European Breakfast :)
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Calabrian Mocha

bW32zmF4GQakNXLVnLHnaA.text: Came here to grab some lunch due to the good reviews. Anyone thinking of coming should note that they don't serve any pasta besides spaghetti until 4PM. They also had no pizza or 80% of their sandwiches available at 1PM on a Friday which was pretty disappointing.   Salad (3/5): just a salad with Italian dressing.  Eggplant Parmesan Sandwich (4/5): this was good compared to everything else we had.  Tuna Sandwich: (3/5): average.  Spaghetti and Meatballs (3/5): pretty basic, noodles were cooked al dente which was nice.  Iced Chai Latte (2/5): could barely taste the chai.   Overall it was $70 for lunch which was definitely not worth it. The customer service was also just okay. I would avoid coming here for lunch.

BMUoAdXeDbXkk1ymDTzabQ.text: Had a chance to try this place for Sunday brunch during a trip back to Pittsburgh and was pretty excited based on the great reviews. The eatery is situated near the Strip District, but far enough that finding parking is not too much of a hassle. Walking in, you instantly notice the charming and unique decor. We grabbed seats at the bar since the place was extremely busy and was able to watch the orchestrated kitchen just off the side of the bar.   After looking through the menu I decided on the Veal Parmesan and no brunch is complete without a Mocha Vanilla Latte. The barista made the latte in front of me and went the extra mile in creating the beautiful steamed milk art you can see in the pictures. The latte itself also had a surprising spice and complimented the full body flavor. The veal came shortly after. Upon first glance, I was a little disappointed with the scarce amount of mozzarella. That disappointment melted away as I took a bite of the veal. It was beyond tender and juicy. The pasta itself did not stand out, but that might be because the veal was that good.   Unfortunately, for me the experience was mixed. The price tag seemed a little steep especially considering how average the pasta was. Though the veal and latte were pretty fantastic. The ambiance and service brings the rating up, so I will definitely not mind coming back to try some of their other offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veal parmesan
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Egg sandwich

p4C0q8f52SX-ruW8nBG12g.text: Best place we ate during our long weekend in Pittsburgh. Would recommend this place to anyone. Great food, great service. Atmosphere eclectic. Hide the bread basket, that stuff is addicting. The bar needs more staff. They are busy serving bar eaters, we waiting customers are kind of a second thought. Not a criticism more an observation. My husband gave up after the first wait. Went back up a second time and got served.

Y2J_ieZxnokqhGDQk6DnZw.text: Delicious!  We had the burrata crostini which was amazing, the greens & beans, also delish. I had the sausage pasta bake which was yummy and my friend had the gnocchi which she also said were delicious.  Would definitely recommend!

Vjti-wm2BhqqC0vYKeyL3g.text: We have eaten dinner here numerous times since nice it opened and have found the food fabulous as well as the service. We were there for brunch today. The French toast and the ricotta and lemon pancakes are yummy.

PINwzHokdWqyYZl48zHQTg.text: Terrific addition to the Pittsburgh dining scene.  Lots of options. Open for breakfast through dinner.

2ecSkFN9rcUPJo324kbB1Q.text: Since my wife and I moved to Pittsburgh in 2016, this restaurant has been our favorite spot to relax and eat together. We move frequently for work and have lived in Hawaii, Texas, North Carolina, Ohio, and Georgia. I have not found a place that compares to DiAnoia's. The food is beyond compare and the subtle changes to the menu throughout the year make coming back again and again too easy. My wife and I have eaten here pretty much once a month since we discovered the place and have never been disappointed. The chef/owner Dave and I met when he was first setting the place up, he was giving away the old furniture that the previous owners left behind, he and his friends helped load some heavy furniture in the back of my truck and told me to come back and eat some delicious, made from scratch food. They were not kidding, the food is phenomenal and deserves to be talked about. Also, the serving staff is always on it, especially our regular server Nicki! Also, this is my first and probably only yelp review, so that should say something. Enjoy and bring a friend!

62hTbF-NqfXQPK3Tp0YdQg.text: Dianoia's, what happened?? Everyone raves about you and then...got a 1/2 Banzino and ended up with 1/4 of a Banzino with a tail piece--all skin and bone and breading. Swapped a side and ended up losing the other side. Other long time DiAnoia's diners at the table were dismayed at my plate. Off day? Hope so....

40sSDUyf6Pv5p0IFXpWdcA.text: Having eaten all over Pittsburgh, I'm thrilled with this relative newbie and find it to be among the best Italian options in our city. It's got a little of everything - besides being a full service restaurant,it also serves breakfast, has a small bar and offers elements of a deli and bottle shot (added bonus is that restaurant guests can visit the coolers and pick out their own beer from a nice selection).The decor is fun, comfortable and anything but stuffy. My only complaint is that it's way too bright.They need to change up the lighting and use the dimmer switch when it's time for the dinner crowd to arrive. Servers are friendly and knowledgeable,but each visit has had its hiccups, once including the server getting orders for four of the five guests, but forgetting mine. Fortunately, the food completely rocks, pushing my overall rating to five stars, overlooking the flaws in service and atmosphere. The crudo appetizer is spectacular. The pasta entrees are delectable. While they tend to be a bit on the rich and heavy side, they're nonetheless perfectly cooked and with top notch ingredients that work well together. The linguine with mussels and garlic is an awesome new spin on the old school linguine with clam sauce. The Tagliatelle with charred radicchio, caramelized shallots, Gorgonzola,fennel, spinach, toasted walnuts and pesto is one of the richer vegetarian pasta dishes that you're likely to try. The restaurant has a bread appetizer on the menu, but if you don't order it,they'll bring you some delicious bread with dipping oil (I can only imagine how good the menu item is, but an up-charge bread menu item in an Italian restaurant just doesn't "fit."). Save room for dessert. They make them in-house and they're darn good. The Ricotta tart is a great option if you prefer a dessert on the more savory side. There's a decent wine list,including lots of by-the-glass options as well. Now if they could just dim the lights and iron some wrinkles to make the service as flawless as it is friendly!

aPdG-GyE10qRgT_1ZJe9zA.text: Me and my boyfriend came here for date night and we were not disappointed.  We started off sharing the burrata crostini and I am literally still fantasizing about it.  Its perfectly salty and creamy and crunchy and if I could eat it every single day, I would.  For the main course, I got the gnocchi, which are legit the size of my fist.  Like I could take one home and use it as a pillow in my bed.  They are huge and puffy and fluffy and everything you could ever want in a potato pasta.  There wasn't too much sauce either, which I liked.  My boyfriend got the mussels and loved them.  We finished it all off with tiramisu which was, again, perfect.  Not too sweet and perfectly moist.  I cannot wait to go back for brunch and pizza.

2gupE-YRGcipVZrUZZAFfw.text: Wow!!   We really enjoyed this "Italian Gem"!!! The food was authentic and very tasty.  The menu selections were fresh and seasonal.   My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed every selection and the cookies were amazing!   Our server was pleasant and very accommodating!   If you love Italian food you certainly won't be disappointed

pURVcgHwjC1s8lsOH_bJOQ.text: A group tried this place out for early dinner and we had a great time. The service was superb from the welcome to the farewell. Loved the proseco on draft!!! The menu was varied enough to satisfy all of us, each with a different palette. Even the deserts were fun. Nice addition to the area-- I would visit again.

wcfyK5GiWb-x1JOUjsvQEA.text: We officially have a new favorite restaurant! First, you must order the bread. It will change your life! Hubby had the beans, sausage and escarole and I had the Heirloom Tomato Tart. Spectacular. We shared the Branzino and my life has been forever changed. Zeppoli for dessert. Their wine list is excellent. Try the Barbaresco for a treat. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. Definitely will be regulars after this visit!

HmAUNAfyJPTuyWaNwYGZLA.text: I wasn't even going to write a review about the terrible service we had Friday evening because the food was so delicious until we opened our left overs today and it wasn't our food.  I will first say, our server was extremely slow with everything, took about 30 minutes to receive our cocktail order once he arrived to the table. We ordered the meat and cheese plate to start, very good and a lot for two people to indulge. Our food came out shortly after, gnocchi, extra order of meatballs, and the squid ink pasta.  Everything was very delicious.  Our server never came to see how our food tasted, my husband and I sat with empty cocktail glasses our entire dinner (would have ordered 3+ more drinks if the server would have been around) we sat with our appetizer and plates of food for over 40 minutes until he came back to see if we wanted anything else.  The restaurant was not that busy for a Friday evening, I am not sure why we were forgotten about. Food I will give an A. Server doesn't deserve anything more than a D, at best.  Disappointed and was hoping for a better dining experience. OH and when we went to eat our left overs the next day... the two boxes of food wasn't our orders!!

Xqd_wWiAxl7W2WQq78vRaQ.text: Love this place! Creative menu with great atmosphere. Everything was super delicious. I got the gnocchi and they were melt in your mouth fantastic!

eYBsA24J5vBMvRrYwqQoTA.text: We really, really wanted to love this restaurant. Local, reasonably priced, and the menu looked awesome. However, it was just ok. My husband and I both ordered a glass of wine and the selections were well-priced and quite good. I enjoyed my burrata appetizer, but it was a little heavy and the bread with which it was served was too thick. My son's brodo with tortellini had good homemade pasta and I enjoyed the sip of broth I sampled. My husband's crudo was nice. The fresh bread served with the meal was also delicious. Our entrees were uneven. My son had the wild boar ragu which he scarfed up quickly. My tagliatelle primavera began with a nice combination of flavors, but after a while it was just too much to eat and the flavors began to feel muddled.  My husbands risotto was horrible -- soupy, bland, and not enjoyable at all. The manager comped us on the risotto, which was kind, but I don't think it should have been served at all -- it was that bad. We are not at all picky eaters, but there was just something a little off about this place. We will, however, return to give it another try.  The service was absolutely flawless and it is clear this is a restaurant that tries hard to please its customers. A little tinkering with some of the menu items and I think it will become a great dining option.

_4h8XTtc8z0RuO-Ov4SWeQ.text: I have been waiting for DiAnoia's to open and was excited to be a part of its first dinner service. The food was amazing. It is hard to decide what the highlight of the meal was, but I probably have to give the prize to the steak Florentine. Chef Dave is cutting the steak to order and cooking it simply with olive oil. The branzino crudo and cauliflower with ricotta, pine nuts and pesto were also delicious. I can't wait to go back for breakfast, lunch and dinner!

tMk-AFok8_iWKh_3IPHs9w.text: We had an excellent meal here. I had pasta with mussels. Pasta was house made and mussels were very fresh. My daughter had crudo for an appetizer and she and my husband thought it was the best dish of the night. Service was good. My only knock is that it seemed too bright inside.

GE8noZ3Hly8VEssFoQ6-nA.text: I enjoyed the place but the biggest single problem was that our young waiter gave us the impression he wanted to turn over the table quickly.  After the four of us were seated, we ordered a bottle of wine and several appetizers and bread and said we wanted to wait a bit before ordering,  After that point, the waiter was by the table maybe 4 times in 15 minutes again and again asking for our dinner order.  I noticed that other servers did not seem to behave in this fashion so maybe it was just the inexperience or impatience of our waiter.  The food was very good, and the house wine selections were just great and very fairly priced.  I would like to try the place again but with another server.

OsVRNAuO7tL2FFBQmrj4aw.text: We have been at DiAnoia's for breakfast when they were first opened and our experience were good ... but not great. Since then, we have heard raving review about their food so we decided to go have dinner. Got there on a Tuesday night 8:00 PM and the restaurant was 2/3 full and bustling. Numerous staff passed us but were too busy to acknowledge our presence. We finally got to the booth when the receptionist was.. She informed us that there is a 15 minute wait. With so many empty *clean* tables. At least 5-6 that we could see. We had to wait at the back of the deli area. After 15 or so minutes with ... we left.

ao1vEPqCZuMLfM2WJrBMAA.text: Our party ordered pasta and thought it was very good and lived up to being homemade. Highly recommend the prosciutto and melon salad. Dessert was excellent-the biscotti were rich-tasting. Definitely an excellent choice!

U_qTUOkSdv3esP62_aONYw.text: Everything about this place is awesome! The decor is simple but unique. It feels like you wondered into a cute restaurant in Italy. I don't remember our waitresses name, but she was lovely and happy to answer all of our menu questions. We ordered "family style" at her recommendation and it worked out perfect. Everything we tried was delicious. The "house" vino was a nice compliment to all of our dishes. And the cooked plate and dinner cocktails were also awesome. If you live in Pittsburgh or you're just visions, like wee were, I would highly recommend this restaurant. Big shout out to Aimee and Dave the owners. There are there and very involved in everything that is going on...making sure your experience is perfect!

hvXC1OPnsG1aYmY--uBPCA.text: Delicious! Had a tremendous dinner there. I'm sure after a couple visits I'll be giving this a 5/5

BYwswzw4UUoRH9Fpk2enWw.text: We ate a lot of good food but the star of the show was the gnocchi in the bread bowl. It was literally DIVINE

-BgKreKXtMykO-IoMXXzkQ.text: Hands down one of the best spots in Pittsburgh. It is perfect for locals and visitors alike and a relaxed atmosphere allows for the food to shine. Handmade pastas like the gnocchi, and Cacio e pepe are excellent. We also love going for breakfast/lunch and order from the deli menu. Their espresso drinks are delicious and well priced. Don't miss their mortadella sandwich and almond cookie with pinenuts (dipped in an espresso).

6WNei5p6JwfC7CV2UbGg5w.text: Absolutely one of the best dinner experiences I've ever had in this city! GO NOW! They are constantly packed, so be sure to make a reservation! I talked about this meal to every single person that I encountered for the next few days. One of my coworkers told me I was being "Di-Annoying"! Haha.  I've seen some other reviews complaining about how close the tables are and that it's loud. If that is enough to bother you and ruin your meal, maybe this isn't the place for you. I would highly suggest you try to ignore it and be happy the number of tables squeezed in has allowed you a spot to eat here! I'm used to this set-up from eating at a lot of traditional Italian places in Philly, so I was not bothered one bit.   Great service from the beginning to the end! Our hostess, Esther, was very welcoming and got us seated right away. Our server, Nicki took great care of us the entire time. She was very friendly and extremely attentive throughout our meal! We went with the 3-Quarter Liter of the house wine which was perfect for the three of us to each to have a few small glasses.  Whatever you do, make sure you order the Brussel sprouts. It was one of the most delicious flavors I've tasted in a long time. I still think about them regularly... slightly charred, with a little crunch, covered in a creamy white cheese sauce. It was unreal. So flavorful, I would have sworn there was meat in it, but it was vegetarian! We also shared the Cauliflower, Ricotta, Pesto & Pine Nut dish which was also wonderful as a starter.  I kept it simple with the Cacio e Pepe with crab meat added. It. Was. Incredible. A simple dish that I wanted to keep eating forever. I still think about it a few weeks later. My fiance went with the Gnocchi while his father had the Beef Cheek Ravioli. Both were decadent and so delicious! Definitely come hungry and be ready to be in a major food coma after! I'm getting ready to make another reservation to go back!

wK5oaw5O6FiSsZU45jRC7w.text: So glad we came across this place. Nice atmosphere, very open, clean and comfortable. Quick service, home made sausage with peppers and onions, side of potatoes and a side of baked cauliflower. Perfect portions to share for an early lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great lunch, home made sausage on fresh baked roll, perfectly carmelized onions and peppers, a side of potatoes and baked cauliflower

EKTbkV1ZuPGTa1z6EWB-YQ.text: The atmosphere at DiAnoia's is incredible. It's very reminiscent of an Italian bistro without feeling forced the way many do. It's a little loud, but not overwhelmingly so.  The wine list was well curated with enough tough-to-find options to make it unique. The pasta was rich but that's why you come somewhere like this, isn't it? I highly recommend the Cacio e Pepe and the homemade bread.  The service was friendly and efficient but never hurried.  All in all, it's a great place for a special occasion with tasty, satisfying food.

mmkuhtESzb3PhocUaCyB6w.text: This is a new personal favorite dining experience. They have an authentic central and southern Italian menu, excellent baked goods including bread and pastries made the same day, excellent hand made fresh pasta made the same day, and a very robust supporting cast of antipasti, contorni, and meat dishes. You will get full on great tasting food. You will have a great time. You will want to come back.  I need to say this up front: primetime reservations are essentially required at this point. This restaurant has really taken off since it began last year and has become quite the well-deserved popular dinner spot. Weekdays are a little easier which is when I've been able to go, but I have never been able to go without needing several weeks advance reservation on a Friday Saturday or Sunday. It is worth booking in advance because this is an excellent dinner spot.  My personal favorites so far have been the appetizer shareable bread, burrata with orzo salad, and their fresh pastas. They do some very classic authentic Italian fresh pasta dishes including linguini al limone, cacio e pepe, spaghetti with meatball that have all been very generous servings, well seasoned and using good ingredients, to become an overall succulent delicious dish. The pasta has always been cooked perfectly, has a good texture and consistency, and full flavor. These pasta chefs know what they are doing, and I am a stickler for well cooked pasta.  I haven't yet been able to have room to eat a meat dish, but the offerings look quite appetizing when seen from a table over.  The ambience is very cute and very Mediterranean inspired. It can be a bit noisy when full, especially given the bar seating and large groups or communal seating that is available. It helps add to the bustling Italian atmosphere in my opinion, but other diners may not appreciate or want this.   Service has always been prompt and excellent and helpful. I have always found the Restaurant very clean, looking chic, as well as having very clean bathrooms.

1Q1a2fxXecSdM3hPf3AM7g.text: Amazing food and a nice amaro selection at the bar. Had an amazing pasta dish, meatball, charcuterie,  and wine to round out the meal. Could definitely afford to invest in some AC during the summer but I understand with the entry and patio doors always opening it could be costly

dDCaeKYPb9PG-dHEuP5sVQ.text: One of my favorite Italian restaurants; hands down!Everything melts in your mouth and always tastes (and is) so fresh! From the pasta to the bread to the fresh-squeezed cocktails. Be prepared to make a reservation days out.

dqa7n-O0kS7pyprholaX9g.text: Absolutely love their food and atmosphere! I wish I could eat here everyday. I've enjoyed many menu items but the fresh whipped ricotta and bread is everything. Also the gnocchi Either way is amazing and the cauliflower is to die for.

_5lgANT6hkuyHvLbK5Y2kA.text: Amazing welcoming place with great real food  and lovely owners! On my top list  Pasta / meatballs / porcheta/ cake and amazing cocktails

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xMVFwNoeymn9Nq2swsCNMA.text: I've been saying I wanted to visit DiAnoia's Eatery for quite some time.  A couple of weeks ago on a Tuesday evening we were trying to decide what was for dinner - close to Lawrenceville and new to all of us.  DiAnoias it was!  The 3 of us were excited to try all the fantastic things we had heard about.  We got a couple apps to share.  The whipped ricotta was amazing - they only gave us a few pieces of bread, and with how much of that amazing ricotta there is - even if you put a TON on the bread - you still need more.  Our waiter graciously gave us a bit more when we got it packaged up to go.  Everyone also enjoyed the olives.  Our entrees were phenomenal.  We have already spoken of going back - as soon as possible - we just have to get our schedules to coordinate.  We can't wait to head back to try the pizza!

A5P6hKc1rfAOZ4ZII2rJ4w.text: I ventured here for my sister's birthday after hearing her talk about it so much since her last birthday she had here. By her recommendation I got the bread bowl and gnocchi. The gnocchi was so tender and delicious, we also ordered the bread with whipped ricotta (so worth the $4!). We had dropped off a cake earlier and they brought it out and served it to us, really playing into the birthday vibe. Overall we had a great experience, our two servers were great (one was a slight bit cocky at times, it was nice we had someone who was a long time staff member though). I know we will be returning next year for her birthday!

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Ix8-GJFdf2zNRn99jcubCA.text: Never had a bad meal here!  Love the pastas and starters. Great variety of mixed drinks. The service is fantastic. Highly recommended all around!

vm_axaZvPs_k79dL_WyOAQ.text: We went to DiAnoia's for dinner. Get the gnocchi bowl and just accept it's likely at least 3,000 calories. It was amazing. thrillist.com/eat/pittsb... The service was pretty good. The bar list was beyond impressive for wines and liqueurs. I had the tiramisu. It was good. I think Piccolo Forno has the best tiramisu, but this was good. That gnocchi bowl though, it was so absurdly good. I feel like I need to fast (or run fast) and just eat that bowl each day.

0XicMe-GwP7IdtxhOAokPw.text: Walked in on a Sunday no reserve, hostess told us it would be 30-40 for a table as many were already reserved. Bar was first come first serve and we kinda got lucky, hung out and got some spots. While the food was excellent my review is mainly for the two amazing people working behind the counter making coffees/espressos/etc and cocktails. I don't even know their names but wow, they were both on point non stop hustle and everything they made was delicious. The girl making all the cocktails deserves an award as does the young man running the espresso/cappuccino machine, this restaurant is incredibly lucky to have such excellent staff. The food was delicious btw! Best breakfast in Pittsburgh for sure!

JGRdNHe-kwdZ-PidcKOiow.text: So I'm conflicted about DiAnoia's. I want to like it. It's an interesting concept. First off, make reservations. We arrived at 6:45 for our 7pm reservation and was seated fairly promptly. Our table was right in the middle of the restaurant. For a Thursday evening, they were very full already. It is very, very noisy. Be prepared to speak a little louder than usual. Also be prepared to be patient. It took our waitress about 10-15 minutes to make her way to our table.   She explained the menu and basics of how to order and a few of her favorite dishes. She did ask us if I was familiar with the internet because their gnocchi is well-known. Just an oddly phrased statement from the waitress.   I took her suggestion with the tagliatelle and my husband came for the meatballs and gnocchi. We also ordered the bread and olive oil with Romano as an appetizer. Save yourself the $8 on the bread. It's pizza dough. There's not much too it including flavor. We didn't order any alcohol because the prices were quite steep.   Close to 45 minutes later, the food arrived. It's all hand-made and anticipate the wait for the food. The lamb tagliatelle is something that you want to have a big bowl of on a cold winter's night. It has deep rich spices blended in with the lamb and the sauce. There's lots of rosemary, cinnamon, and all-spice that really develops the flavor of the dish. The gnocchi are very soft and pillowy in a delicious garlicky marinara. But....the meatballs had a lot of fennel in them. They needed more basic seasoning and a lot less fennel.   The meal portions are fairly appropriate to the style and cost. We also ordered some cookies and coffee for desert. Coffee was delicious. The cookies resembled the consistency of a wooden shim or a doorstop. They were burnt on the bottom, dry, and hard. Truly a let down.   Bottom line....it was okay. I wasn't over the moon. Nothing stood out or caused me to have a life-changing dinner moment. The waitress mostly left us alone. Parts of the meal were hit and miss. It's a welcome addition to the Strip District. Did I enjoy it? I guess. Do I need/want to go back? Probably not.

ZMlKn9aENQuRPaCI1YqxjQ.text: One of the worst meals I have had in Pgh. The risotto was crunchy and watery, a bad combo. Skip this place at all cost.  Reply: I should have stated I was there about a year ago and indeed risotto was on the menu and awful. I'm glad to see that you no longer serve it. I have not been back since that meal but hopefully things have improved.

s9CzrnvCyGRSE1z5sdTY_Q.text: If you are looking for a super cute but quality brunch place, come to DiAnoia's! A new and vibrant eatery along Penn Ave. They have a nice bar area as well as a decent sized seating area. Their brunch menu had plenty of options that I was eager to try. I ended up ordering a mocha and the prosciutto eggs benedict. My friend ordered the french toast.   The mocha was smooth and well-made. The eggs benedict was delicious. Every layer was perfect from the crunchy english muffin, salty prosciutto, and creamy spinach to the poached egg with hollandaise sauce.The hollandaise sauce was creamy but not too thick just the perfect consistency. My only complaint was the egg should have been a bit more runnier. The side of potatoes also were great, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.  My friend's french toast was made using panettone bread so she said it was unique but could have used a little more fruit or toppings. Overall, a nice addition to the Strip District. I would love to come back to try lunch or dinner here.

Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Panettone French toast
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mocha!

jb6iPPYUbk5ATX9_wxelng.text: Bright, open and inviting cafe. Very cute! We were here for brunch and it was simply amazing. I had the tumeric  ginger tea....wow. I get herb tea all over pgh and its never like this.  I wasn't super hungry so I went with the ricotta honey yogurt and a couple scrambled eggs. The yogurt was heavenly and eggs; simple and flavorful.  I got to.try a couple of bites of the eggs benedict....I never get this dish normally because i don't think it that good... But after having it here, i now understand.  It was AMAZING!  just yum.  The coffee was great and the staff very helpful and welcoming. We'll be back. Like next week....

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TRAlPa48TTm_9WazPqiYOw.text: I really enjoyed DiAnoia's. The decorations and general aesthetics totally matched mine, which is a plus for those Instagram pics! I went on a Sunday, so have only tried their brunch but will probably visit during dinner (their menu sounds delicious).  The service was great - despite us arriving closer to closing time than we would like. Our waitress was very helpful and attentive. The food was also tasty and I wished that we could've tried more! We got mimosas, the personal pizza, the eggs benedict, and the stuffed cornetti. The pizza was fantastic, as well as what I had of the eggs benedict. That day's pizza consisted of mozzarella, tomatoes, peaches, some cured meat that I don't quite remember, red onions, and topped with an egg. I was disappointed by the cornetti, however. Perhaps it was because it was made earlier that day but the pastry was not buttery and flaky as I would have liked.   Overall, this was one of the best brunch experiences I have had in a while.

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Stuffed cornetti
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Prosciutto eggs benedict
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Personal pizza

odWzyH61Rvhtg_OA6RWb6w.text: I hate waiting in line, but when the bartender makes a great negroni, makes the wait a bit better.  We ended up waiting for an hour and a half on a Saturday since we didn't have reservation before we were finally sat at the bar, but the food makes it all worth it.  We decided to start with the Fresh Bread and the Prosciutto & Melon.  The Fresh Bread is essentially baked pizza dough then drizzled with olive oil and Parmigiano Reggiano.  You could add fresh ricotta but we decided to eat it as is because it already sounded pretty amazing, and it was. The bartender actually just got us a free helping of the ricotta and with the 1st bite, we knew why people get it.  Ricotta was super silky and yea, totally worth the $4 add on.  Prosciutto & Melon was very interesting since it had this pepper & red onion relish.  Didn't eat much of the relish since the prosciutto and melon were good on its own.  For pastas, we got two to share and went with a special of the day, which was this Oyster Mushroom Cacio e Pepe and the recommended Heirloom Tomato Tripoline. First off, pastas portions are pretty big.  Both pastas exceeded our expectations, especially the latter.  The cacio e pepe was very good and the oyster mushroom is a nice touch, but the tripoline was definitely the star of thee meal. Apparently it's only available during tomato season so if it is available, definitely go for it.   We ended the night with some classic zeppoles.  Can't go wrong with that!  Overall great meal - had a great time sitting at the bar.  Definitely try to get reservations if you can, even it is early or late.

w1j35aolpOh22HTSMTADxQ.text: I was really pleasantly surprised by DiAnoia's. I had heard of them because of the "gnocchi in a bread bowl" thing and was not sure if this was going to be a gimmicky one-hit-wonder for tourists or a legit restaurant.  The menu was actually really interesting and I had a hard time deciding what to eat because everything looked so good (squash blossom ravioli? crispy chicken leg with mushrooms and pasta?). Ended up getting an appetizer that was a salad of peaches, saffron marscapone, fennel, and dill, the gnocchi + breadbowl (had to try it), and a side of chanterelles (which were somehow only $8??). There was also a special chanterelle carbonara that was very tempting.  As soon as I got my appetizer any concern that this was just a gimmicky restaurant was completely gone. It was incredible! I would never have put those flavors together myself and it was extremely well done. The gnocchi + breadbowl was also delicious but incredibly heavy -- would split with someone next time (though it heated up very well in my oven the next day). Chanterelles were excellent and confirmed that this is a restaurant that knows their stuff.  I visited with a friend, and halfway through our meal we were plotting monthly trips to try the entire menu. This might be my new favorite restaurant in PGH. Next time I'm planning to try another interesting appetizer and their version of my favorite pasta dish (pasta alla norma), now that I know they won't mess it up! (only negative = very loud! also, definitely get reservations)

3M8pHBZkSvzdBxq77h5pYw.text: My first time at DiAnoia's was a few years ago for restaurant week and I loved it. I finally made it back and reaffirmed its self as a solid choice on my restaurant list.   I did think the wine list was a little pricey. Not many bottles (especially red) in the low $40s range. We were celebrating my husbands birthday so we did get a bottle but I think a glass might be the way to go next time.   For an appetizer we had the heirloom tomato salad and it was amazing! The tomatoes were so fresh and the cheese was like a mix of burrata and ricotta. Yum!   If you go there and the gnocchi bread bowl is on the menu: you must get it! It was so aggressive but so so so good. It's like pasta and pizza all in one.  The sauce was good and it was super cheesy. We also had one of the pasta specials which had rabbit and a lemon sauce. This was also really tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pasta special - rabbit with a lemon sauce
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gnocchi bread bowl - a must try!!!

BvnqDl6AWNSNu_5jzlBdBg.text: To sum up the review, I think it is over rated.  I think everyone in Pittsburgh has heard good things about DiAnoia's. Many of my friends are die hard fans. So I was really excited to try this out. I made reservations a month ahead because I know how hard to get in. So me and my husband came in for dinner to celebrate his birthday. We got some bread, clam back and gnocchi with meatballs. The clam bake and bread were super good. You can taste the freshness. 5 star for these two. But my disappointment comes from the gnocchi and meatballs even that is what they are known for I think. The gnocchi were very soft and meatball was lack of flavor. The sauce was mediocre. Nothing special, I guess just house made and fresh ingredients?   Anyway, I wouldn't think this is the best Italian restaurant in town base on what I had. Maybe the other things would be better? I think I will give it another try for some other items on the menu. But it didn't reach my expectations.

SWgrmWcEkLVoVQhYTKc2Gg.text: Hands down best Italian and brunch in the city.  I have had multiple 5 star experiences with both.  You can't go wrong with anything you order. Prices are great.  Service is great.  I recommend a  reservation as it gets pretty packed on weekends.  The spaghetti pie at brunch is my favorite.  Coffee and drinks are out of this world!

1gwKe0Y1UFukpTKFFixtmg.text: So this is a place I've had my eye on for a while--happy to report that it did not disappoint! I had the restaurant week special, which included the zeppoles, eggs Benedict and an aperol spritz. Everything was hot, fresh and fantastic. I'm officially obsessed. I cannot wait to come back and try this place for dinner! I want the gnocchi bowl SO BAD. Looks amazing.   Definitely make a reservation because it's always crazy busy--for good reason!

photos.caption: Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs Benedict, French toast

8LrRaES1NC6kbjHxEg522w.text: We returned to DiAnoia's for August 2019 Restaurant week. I have to say that the special menu is what decided this for me. The peaches and cream antipasto was amazing. Mascarpone flavored with saffron provided a savory complement to the fresh peaches and fennel, topped by fresh dill. There were two pasta dishes offered - cacao e pepe, which my husband ordered, adding shrimp, and pasta alla Norma, which was my choice. Both dishes were wonderful, and the housemade pasta was the star of each. Dessert on this special menu was tiramisu, and it was classic and rich.   Not only will I return, but already plan to bring guests here when they come to town. Great food!

Photo of DiAnoia's Eatery - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pasta alla Norma- casarecce,eggplant, San marzano tomatoes, ricotta salata

aoMAMWrVY3xCM0JESzT-TA.text: Enjoyed my first time here for sure! The pasta and other ingredients are very fresh and service is great. I was told their menu changes up so I hope this review helps!  The bread with olive and cheese was delicious but not worth $8 in my opinion. I would probably not get it in the future. I recommend the clam bake, the flavor was really on point. I would wish they used bigger clams though to get the full seafood effect. The drinks were well made and reasonably priced.   Recommend the alla norma and the cavatelli di pollo. The taste for the all norma is more bland than expected, would have appreciated more of a kick in the sauce. The cavatelli had a great contrast in the lemony taste and the crispy chicken leg. I was sad they ran out of the carbonara, it looked delicious.  I would definitely come back to this place! I look forward to their other dishes as well. Great outdoor seating in the summer. The place was surprisingly big so not too bad of a wait!
